context/2: That's right.
context/3: You don't tell us how to nurse babies, so we don't tell you how to fight Comanches.
context/5: You're leaving it up to us?
context/6: We can let them burn us out or carry the fight to them.
context/7: Good soldiers ought to know the truth

context: How about that?
context/1: Now wait a minute Bob, he didn't mean it.
context/2: You think I'm yella, is that it?
context/3: Yeah, I heard what you said.
context/5: What do you mean yella, huh?
context/7: They're all to yella to call his bluff.
context/8: You know, you sound like them Europeans.
context/9: I don't want to be nowheres around when the bomb starts fallin'.

context: That's what I wanted to know.
response: Mr. Prosecutor, you must admit that the testimony of this witness has become hopelessly impaired.
context/2: The point is, Mr. Keddie, can you swear that the woman you picked up on Sunset wasn't the defendant?
context/3: I can't remember them too well.
context/4: You pick up a lot of people.
context/5: Well, you know how it is.
context/6: Was one of those women this defendant?
context/7: They got out and paid off.

context: I may have.
context/1: Now, had you ever seen Mr. Davenport before you treated him at the Vista Motel?
context/2: I should like you to remember, doctor, that you're under oath.
context/4: Had he ever consulted you at your office?
context/5: I don't understand.
context/6: Had you ever seen Mr. Davenport before you were called in?
context/7: I live just around the corner.
context/9: Are you the only doctor in the neighbourhood?

context: That's where I happened to be roving at the time.
context/0: Well, I'm a roving reporter now and I...
context/1: I find it remarkable how you gentleman of the press arrived at the spot so quickly.
context/2: By the way,
context/4: Please drink up and pay up.
context/5: Time, gentleman.
context/7: Come on now, Sergeant, we're talking about progress and you can't report anything because you haven't made any.
context/8: Then the criminal would know what we're doing, too, wouldn't he?
context/9: Now, look here, you can't expect us to tell you every move we make, you know.
